intro:
Welcome to PokéVoid! This is a battle-focused Pokémon fangame with roguelite elements.
$This game is not monetized and we claim no ownership of Pokémon nor of the copyrighted assets used.
$The game is a work in progress, but fully playable.
For bug reports, please use the Discord community.
$If the game runs slowly, please ensure 'Hardware Acceleration' is turned on in your browser settings.
menu:
From this menu you can access the settings.
$From the settings you can change game speed, window style, and other options.
$There are also various other features here, so be sure to check them all!
starterSelect:
From this screen, you can select your starters by pressing
Z or the Space bar. These are your initial party members.
$Each starter has a value. Your party can have up to
6 members as long as the total does not exceed 10.
$You can also select gender, ability, and form depending on
the variants you've caught or hatched.
$The IVs for a species are also the best of every one you've
caught or hatched, so try to get lots of the same species!
pokerus:
A daily random 3 selectable starters have a purple border.
$If you see a starter you own with one of these,
try adding it to your party. Be sure to check its summary!
statChange:
Stat changes persist across battles as long as your Pokémon aren't recalled.
$Your Pokémon are recalled before a trainer battle and before entering a new biome.
$You can view the stat changes for any Pokémon on the field by holding C or Shift.
$You can also view the moveset for an enemy Pokémon by holding V.
$This only reveals moves that you've seen the Pokémon use this battle.
selectItem:
After every battle, you are given a choice of 3 random items.
You may only pick one.
$These range from consumables, to Pokémon held items, to passive permanent items.
$Most non-consumable item effects will stack in various ways.
$Some items will only show up if they can be used, such as evolution items.
$You can also transfer held items between Pokémon using the transfer option.
$The transfer option will appear in the bottom right once you have obtained a held item.
$You may purchase consumable items with money, and a larger variety will be available the further you get.
$Be sure to buy these before you pick your random item, as it will progress to the next battle once you do.
eggGacha:
From this screen, you can redeem your vouchers for
Pokémon eggs.
$Eggs have to be hatched and get closer to hatching after
every battle. Rarer eggs take longer to hatch.
$Hatched Pokémon also won't be added to your party, they will
be added to your starters.
$Pokémon hatched from eggs generally have better IVs than
wild Pokémon.
$Some Pokémon can only even be obtained from eggs.
$There are 3 different machines to pull from with different
bonuses, so pick the one that suits you best!

accessMenu.title: Accessing the Menu
accessMenu.text: To access the menu, press M or Escape while awaiting input. The menu contains settings and various features.

pokerogue.title: Giving PokéRogue The Credit It Deserves

text.1: Without PokéRogue's brilliant design, PokéVoid wouldn't be here today! Their extendable framework let me experiment, BREAK, and make PokéVoid what it is today!
text.2: Where PokéRogue stands as a shining beacon of what a Pokémon roguelike should be...
text.3: PokéVoid attempts to venture into the shadows, bringing a touch of beautiful chaos and corruption to their near-perfect formula.
text.4: If you love daily runs, events, challenge modes? Endless or Splice modes? Visit pokerogue.net and play the original!

text.1: With each purchase the shop inventory changes! Use it to your advantage, and be sure to get what you need first!
text.2: Keep an eye out for FREE items, they randomly appear in the shop's inventory!

text.1: Press R to view the current run details immediately (when you're in the battle / rewards / title screen)
Past Rivals you defeated echo from the void, these beings are not what they seem.
text.2: Corrupted entities twisted by the void, their true form lies in wait for you in the void. Save them.

text.1: You can now upgrade moves! Each time you use a move it'll gain an EXP point!
text.2: Once the move has enough EXP, it'll level up, giving you a choice of upgrades!
text.3: The upgrade will last for the whole run, and change the move for everyone, including your team, and even your enemies!

text.1: Choose one upgrade, and for the whole run that move will be upgraded for everyone, including your team, and even your enemies!
text.2: Since you can upgrade almost any move, some combinations will not work or break the game, unfortunately with the scale of this update, this is unavoidable.
text.3: If this happens, please refresh and choose a different upgrade combination.
text.4: If you find a combination that doesn't work, please join discord and add it to the list of broken combinations!
text.5: Please note that Moves can only have ONE effect chance (i.e. 10% chance to paralyze), so upgrades EITHER directly change the effect chance, OR use the previous chance value!
text.6: Lastly, Upgrades can overwrite each other, the newest upgrade gets priority!

text.1: PokéVoid lets you make ANY Pokémon legendary!
text.2: By using Glitch Items you can make Pokemon have new abilities, types, moves, stats, and more!
text.3: The Void awaits, Trainer. Embrace the forbidden power to overcome it!

text.1: Each run features a random rival with a themed team and signature Pokémon!
text.2: Defeat them to unlock Glitch Quests for NEW Pokémon forms!

stats.title: Checking Your Stats
stats.text: To see your game stats, access the menu and select 'Stats'. This will show you your total battles, wins, money, and other stats!

text.1: See info on your past teams! Access via the menu and select 'Run History'.
text.2: This will show you your previous runs, including your team, items, results, and more!

rivalQuests.title: Glitch Quests
rivalQuests.text: Defeat rivals to unlock Glitch Quests! Purchase these from the PermaShop and complete them to permanently unlock powerful Glitch Forms for specific Pokémon!

text.1: Meet Smitom, a special Rotom in Smitty form! He's a guide and a mystery...
text.2: Interact with him when an exclamation mark appears or save your game for potential rewards.

text.1: Unlock over 150 new Glitch and Smitty evolutions!
text.2: Glitch forms are unlocked via Rival Quests, unlocking Smitty forms is a mystery...

text.1: PokéVoid is in Beta! If you find a bug, please report it on the Discord.
text.2: Include a screenshot of your console (control+i in chrome) and your save file if possible. Your feedback helps improve the game!

unlockJourney.title: Unlock Journey Mode By Catching Pokemon

text.1: Journey Mode becomes available after catching 15 Pokémon, and lets you select your starting team from your collected Pokémon!
text.2: After catching your first pokemon, go to the SHOP and get the Starter Catch Quest to offically begin the Journey Unlock Quest!

text.1: Hatching eggs is a powerful way to strengthen your team! Unlike wild catches, hatched Pokémon join your starter pool with superior IVs!
text.2: Eggs are also the only way to obtain certain rare Pokémon species! Making them essential for completing your collection!
text.3: To use Egg Vouchers, simply press ESC or M to open the menu and select Egg Gacha!

text.1: Check your hatched Pokémon and if desired, swap 1 for one of your party members!
text.2: Only restrictions are your first Pokémon can't be swapped, and legendaries can only be swapped with legendaries, Megas, or Dynamaxed Pokémon!

nuzlight.title: Nuzlight Mode
nuzlight.text: A lighter version of Nuzlocke with no permanent Pokémon loss. No healing items available in shops! Fainted Pokémon revive after reaching wave 10 milestones.

nuzlocke.title: Nuzlocke Mode
nuzlocke.text: Traditional Nuzlocke challenge rules apply. Fainted Pokémon are permanently removed from your party.

text.1: Assemble your team to take on The Void. Use any Pokémon you've caught or hatched, including fusions!
text.2: Fusion Pokémon require ∞GOLD to use. PermaItems can reduce costs and increase your starter limit.

rogueMode.title: Rogue Mode
rogueMode.text: Draft 2 random pokemon to start your run with! Use your ∞GOLD to reroll your options! Each run is unique!

bosses.title: Multi-Form Bosses
bosses.text: Beware of powerful multi-form bosses! They change form and fully heal at low HP, resetting stat changes. Defeat them for valuable rewards!

text.1: Master over 400 new abilities from 150+ Glitch and Smitty Pokémon transformations!
text.2: New game modes expand the abilities obtainable from items, including powerful Glitch abilities that can redefine battles.

text.1: Grants your pokemon a passive ability, providing an extra ability!
text.2: These do not stack, so if you get a second one, it WILL replace the first one!

text.1: Collect Glitch Pieces to get reality-altering Glitch Items! Need 2+ pieces for Glitch Items, 5+ for Glitch Form Change items.
text.2: Items include AnyTMs, Ability Swappers, Type Changers, Stat Swaps, and more!

text.1: All Fusion Pokémon are catchable and permanently added to your collection!
text.2: Find them with a base 1/14 chance (improvable with ∞ITEMS). Using them costs ∞GOLD.

text.1: Most trainers will sell their Pokémon during battle (except Rivals!). Caught Pokémon are added permanently to your collection!
text.2: The cost depends on the wave but can be reduced with ∞ITEMS.

text.1: Obtainable via the Shop, these expensive abilities apply to ALL Pokémon in your current party during a run!
text.2: Use powerful team-wide effects: Speed Boost or Technician for everyone!

text.1: Earn persistent ∞GOLD between runs! Use it to buy ∞ITEMS, reroll Rogue starters, or pay the Fusion Tax.
text.2: Get it from bounties, rewards, saving, or Smitom interactions.

text.1: If your data is lost it's GONE FOREVER! Use the floppy disk icon (top-right) to EXPORT your save file often!
text.2: This rewards ∞GOLD and protects against data loss.

text.1: Enter 6-letter codes in the console to activate Bounties.
text.2: Bounties are QUESTS that let you earn ∞GOLD/∞ITEMS and are completely reusable upon completion!

dailyBounty.title: Daily Bounty!
dailyBounty.text: A new daily bounty is available! Complete it to earn ∞GOLD/∞ITEMS. The code is already in the console, just activate it!

discord.title: Discord & Support
discord.text: Join the Smittyverse Discord for discussion, bug reports, and community! Find bounty codes and connect with other players.

text.1: Create unique Pokémon transformations using specific combinations of FOUR Smitty items!
text.2: Some require a specific base Pokémon (e.g., Rotom -> Smitom)
text.3: Others are Universal, so any base Pokémon can be used! (e.g., Caterpie -> Picklisk). All gain a random passive ability.

text.1: You've unlocked a new Smitty form! Each smitty form is different!
text.2: But ALL need a unique combination of 4 Smitty items!
text.3: The combination is identified via the console, find the SMITTY form's code and enter it to see the forbidden recipe!

text.1: Use ∞GOLD to buy permanent upgrades (∞ITEMS) with different duration types: Usage-based (quantity reduced after use) or Wave-based (quantity reduced after wave 50).
text.2: These upgrades can boost shiny/fusion/catch rates, lower costs, and provide other permanent benefits!

abilitySwitcher.title: Glitch: Ability Switcher
abilitySwitcher.text: Swap a Pokémon's current ability with one of its other ones! Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

typeSwitcher.title: Glitch: Type Switchers
typeSwitcher.text: Change a Pokémon's primary AND secondary types. Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

primarySwitcher.title: Glitch: Primary Type Switcher
primarySwitcher.text: Change a Pokémon's primary type. Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

secondarySwitcher.title: Glitch: Secondary Type Switcher
secondarySwitcher.text: Change a Pokémon's secondary type. Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

text.1: Release a Pokémon to grant it's typing, moves, abilities, or a stat boost to another.
text.2: Alternatively, spend 5 'Collected Types' from a Pokémon instead of releasing it.

anyTMs.title: Glitch: AnyTMs
anyTMs.text: These TMs can teach their move to ANY Pokémon, ignoring normal compatibility rules. Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

anyAbilities.title: Glitch: Ability Item
anyAbilities.text: Change a Pokémon's current ability to another ability! Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

statSwitchers.title: Glitch: Stat Switchers
statSwitchers.text: Swap two of a Pokémon's base stats (e.g., Attack and Defense). Requires 2 Glitch Pieces.

newQuests.title: New Quest Unlocked!
newQuests.text: You've unlocked a new quest! It will appear RANDOMLY (but often) in the PermaShop / Shop on the title screen! If it's not there, reroll for it!

modeUnlocks.title: GameMode Unlocks
modeUnlocks.text: When a game mode is unlocked, it will also unlock a ton of new items and abilities! Try to unlock them all!

firstVictory.title: It's Not Over!
firstVictory.text: Your journey is just beginning! Unlock the new game modes to dive deeper into the abyss, and unravel the mysteries of the void!

theVoidUnlocked.title: The Void Unlocked!
theVoidUnlocked.text: The Void where it all began. The source of all corruption. The true face of the void awaits...

theVoidOvertaken.title: You've Overtaken The Void!
theVoidOvertaken.text: You've become too powerful for the void to contain! Yet the corruption persists, don't let it spread, you're the only one who can keep it under control!

text.1: To Mega Evolve or Dynamax a Pokémon, you must first have the Mega Bracelet or Dynamax Band items!
text.2: Once you have one of these items, and have the appropriate pokemon, a form change item will randomly appear as a reward item!
text.3: After mega evolution or dynamaxing, the Mega Bracelet or Dynamax Band will break!

text.1: Taking inspiration from roguelike masters Slay the Spire, Inscryption, and many more, Pokevoid's CHAOS modes let you choose the path you'll take next!
text.2: Plan your path, and do your best to overcome the Chaos within the VOID!
text.3: Enter the Gauntlet! Take on wave after wave of intense encounters!
text.4: Pokerogue's OG battle style, intensively remixed with random Pokevoid madness and game breaking mechanics!
text.5: Go forth trainer, embrace the void's forbidden power, and make ANY Pokémon legendary!

text.1: 16 months of solo dev madness means everything - every time someone like you has a blast playing this game. If my weird ideas actually work and you're having fun,
text.2: then maybe - I'm closer to my dream of becoming an actual game developer. Thank you so much for playing my chaotic, broken version of PokéRogue! - Smitty
